Data: 7.05pm Hello and welcome to the first T20 between Australia and England as this tour reaches its final leg. First to the toss and Australia have won it and will bat first as the hosts attempt to complete a clean sweep of all the formats. But, writes Daniel Brettig, the T20s provide England with a winning chance.
Broad to White, 3 runs length ball wide enough outside off for White to swing at, he gets it over cover but not timed well enough to get it to the rope
Broad to Finch, no run better line and Finch plays forward up on the off side
Broad to Finch, 1 run touch straight and clipped out to deep square leg - very short boundary that side, 60 yards at best
Broad to White, no run fuller length on off stump, pushed forward up on the off side
Broad to White, no run good length just outside off, it nips back a little and beats the loose prod to cover of White who's beaten on the inside edge
Broad to White, no run good length on off stump, White knocks it down towards cover
Dernbach to Finch, 1 run back of a length slower ball on off stump, Finch stays inside it and guides it behind point for a single
Dernbach to White, 2 runs firm drive on the up to the right of mid-off, Broad is down to half-save very smartly with a dive
Dernbach to White, no run straighter line, blocked coming forward up towards point
Dernbach to White, no run White stepped to leg, Dernbach followed him and tucks him up well, White can only fend to midwicket
Dernbach to White, SIX runs another step to leg, this time White frees himself up nicely and swings a length ball over square leg into the building site
Dernbach to White, no run full at the stumps, played forward to midwicket
Broad to Finch, SIX runs full at the off stump and Finch swings it down the ground, lovely clean strike into the stands, dead straight
Broad to Finch, no run better length and Finch forced into blocking around the off stump
Broad to Finch, 1 run full on off stump and driven out to long-on who's gone back
Broad to White, no run full length on off stump, blocked up to mid-on

Broad to White, 2 runs full length outside off, driven without moving his feet, clean outside edge, straight to Root who drops the chance and it was a sitter in all fairness, little movement down to his right knee and it went straight through his hands
Broad to White, 1 run full at the stumps, flicked wide of mid-on for a quick single
Bresnan to White, 1 wide slides down the leg side with White giving himself room
Bresnan to White, 1 run length ball, clipped into midwicket for an easy single
Bresnan to Finch, no run just back of a length at the stumps, just blocked in the crease
Bresnan to Finch, no run shorter, goes to pull but was cramped up with Bresnan following Finch shuffling to leg, gets hit on the shoulder
Bresnan to Finch, SIX runs full at the stumps, slower ball, picked up beautifully over midwicket, just a little clip and almost into the building site again
Bresnan to Finch, 1 run drags the length back slightly, pushed into the covers and a quick single
Bresnan to White, no run very full on off stump, White steps to leg and tries to swing it down the ground, gets it low on the bat to mid-on
Dernbach to Finch, FOUR runs little width outside off and guided backward of square to third man
Dernbach to Finch, FOUR runs fuller length, Finch swings through the line again and finds cow corner, largely clubbed that
Dernbach to Finch, SIX runs swings again and goes straight over the bowler's head, better timing on this and over the advertising hoarding it goes
Dernbach to Finch, 1 run slower ball on off stump, dabbed into the covers and they race a single
Dernbach to White, no run forward press just outside off, finds cover
Dernbach to White, 1 run slower ball full toss but it nearly deceives White who gets a thick inside edge to short long leg
Bresnan to White, 1 run step to leg, Bresnan follows him on a length, gets pushed wide of mid-on
Bresnan to Finch, 1 run length on off stump, dabbed into the covers for another quick single
Bresnan to White, 1 run turned through square leg this time
Bresnan to Finch, no run full length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
Bresnan to Finch, 1 run back foot firm punch wide enough of point for a single
Bresnan to White, no run tapped into the off side and finds cover
Bopara to Finch, FOUR runs full toss on the stumps, clipped past short long leg, poor ball
Bopara to Finch, 1 run very full at the off stumps, played firmly to extra cover who can only fumble
Bopara to White, SIX runs length ball at the stumps, swung over the leg side and just evades deep-square leg, only just
Bopara to White, no run slower ball at the off stump, just blocked back to the bowler
Bopara to White, 1 run slower ball on the stumps again, this is worked wide of the bowler and they get a quick single
Bopara to Finch, no run length just outside off, guided to short third man and there's no run available
Briggs to White, no run White steps to leg and slips a little trying a violent swing to the off side, finds cover
Briggs to White, 1 run steps down and lifts this over cover, on the bounce to the sweeper
Briggs to Finch, FOUR runs back and crashed from off stump through point, beats the sweeper to the rope
Briggs to Finch, FOUR runs fuller length and Finch smashes this up and over extra cover, nailed
Briggs to Finch, 1 run full length at middle and leg, tucked through square leg, they push for two but it's not on
Briggs to White, FOUR runs dabbed reverse sweep, bit of an edge but gets it very fine and it skips away to the boundary
Bopara to Finch, 1 wide slower ball outside off, called wide but it was inside the guideline outside off and Finch was simply done in the flight
Bopara to Finch, 1 run shorter length, chopped from off stump to short third man
Bopara to White, SIX runs back of a length, pulled hard over midwicket and evades deep-midwicket
Bopara to White, 1 run hard swing to leg, along the floor to deep-midwicket this time
Bopara to Finch, no run slower ball, forward on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Bopara to Finch, 2 runs back of a length, chopped wide of deep cover, they get back for two and Finch gets fifty
Bopara to Finch, no run fuller at the stumps, driven back to the bowler off high on the bat
Briggs to White, FOUR runs full length on the stumps, flourishing swing through the line, opens the face and whacks it wide of long-off, fabulous stroke
Briggs to White, 2 runs over the wicket now, flat delivery, placed wide enough of deep-midwicket for a couple
Briggs to White, 1 run similar delivery, worked too close to the deep-midwicket this time
Briggs to Finch, 1 wide leg side delivery, Finch tries to slog sweep and misses
Briggs to Finch, 1 run length delivery, worked out to deep-square leg
Briggs to White, FOUR runs full length on the stumps, an unusual slap across the line and works it past short long leg and gets four, 100 up
Briggs to White, 2 runs tossed up and pushed out to deep-midwicket but Bopara is too slow coming in and it's two more and fifty for White
Broad to Finch, no run full length wide of off stump, Finch had stepped to leg and was well away from it
Broad to Finch, 1 run full length at the stumps, forced down to long-on
Broad to White, 1 run full toss on the stumps, tried to be swung to leg, totally miscued off the splice but it's hit so badly it falls well short of long-on running in
Broad to Finch, OUT but this carries to long-on as Finch swung hard at a length ball, aiming at the leg side and didn't get it anywhere near the middle, straight to Hales who took a solid catch
Broad to White, FOUR runs delicately ran down fine past short third man, deft touch from just outside off
Broad to White, 1 run full at the stumps, driven to long-on
Briggs to White, 1 run leg stump line, careful push out to long-on
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 run goes for the reverse sweep first ball and was lucky to get some glove on that in front of all three, it rebounds to point and they get a quick single
Briggs to White, 2 runs plays forward and runs it in between the two deep leg side fielders
Briggs to White, 1 run full outside leg stump and ran to deep-square leg
Briggs to Maxwell, no run forward and gets hit on the pad flicking to leg
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 wide down the leg side for a wide, sharp take from Buttler
Briggs to Maxwell, no run goes for the slog sweep and it hits the pad and runs not far enough away from Buttler for a leg bye
Wright to White, SIX runs steps to leg and heaves a length ball across the line onto the bank over midwicket
Wright to White, FOUR runs cutter on the stumps and White manages to steer it backward of square, unlucky for the bowler that
Wright to White, FOUR runs full a foot outside off, slapped wide of long-on, excellent placement, timed well too

Wright to White, (no ball) 1 run full toss wide of off stump, swung at and it comes off a huge top edge and short long leg comes in and takes the catch but the bowler's end umpire has called no-ball on height, I'm not too sure about that, they're not even checking upstairs. Or maybe they are now asking for the third umpire, which makes perfect sense, it's
Wright to Maxwell, 1 run length on the stumps, tried to be swung to leg and gets a toe end into the leg side for a single

Wright to White, OUT full and straight, White swings hard across the line, huge appeal for lbw and given out England needed that badly. Looks pretty straight and struck the pad low, so it looks likely that would have hit leg stump, Hawk Eye has it only clipping but the real time shot looked good
Wright to Bailey, 1 run full on the stumps, pressed into midwicket for an easy single
Briggs to Bailey, no run length at the stumps, tucked to point stepping back
Briggs to Bailey, 1 run down the track, worked to short long leg and they take a sharp single
Briggs to Maxwell, FOUR runs reverse sweep from outside leg and gets enough bat to clear point
Briggs to Maxwell, SIX runs goes again and this is nailed over cover for six! Pietersen-esque! Nails the reverse slog sweep into the stands, amazing shot
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 wide leg side wide
Briggs to Maxwell, 2 runs full on leg stump, clipped to deep-midwicket, they take on Bopara for the second and get home comfortably
Briggs to Maxwell, FOUR runs conventional sweep this time and finds the gap backward of square
Broad to Bailey, 1 run forward just outside off, dabbed into the covers for a single
Broad to Maxwell, no run full length wide of off stump, tried to be carved off the back foot but misses
Broad to Maxwell, 1 run straighter and dabbed into square leg for a quick single
Broad to Bailey, 1 run length outside off, pushed to short third man for a quick single
Broad to Maxwell, no run full at the off stump, a huge heave to leg brings an inside edge that doesn't carry through to Buttler
Broad to Maxwell, 1 run length ball on off stump, dabbed into the covers for a single

Bopara to Maxwell, OUT full on the stumps, goes to reverse slog sweep and chips it to point easy catch for Bresnan. Horrible shot really, he never gets his head down enough does Maxwell. Back of the hand delivery from Bopara does the trick, Maxwell never got under the full delivery
Bopara to Lynn, 1 run full length turned into the leg side, just a single
Bopara to Bailey, no run back of a length at the body, Bailey misses with a pull
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run full at the stumps, forced down the ground off an inside edge, just a single
Bopara to Lynn, no run similar length delivery, tried to be pushed up the wicket but only finds the bowler this time
Bopara to Lynn, 1 run length just outside off, pressed to cover
Bresnan to Lynn, SIX runs length at the stumps, a stand and deliver smash straight over the bowler's head
Bresnan to Lynn, 1 run better length, this is forced down to long-off
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run full length wide of off stump, reached for and chipped just short of extra cover
Bresnan to Lynn, 1 wide yorker length wide of off stump, too wide this time
Bresnan to Lynn, 1 run full at the stumps, forced down the ground and just one to long-on
Bresnan to Bailey, 2 runs full just outside off, steered wide of third man for a couple
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run full again, driven out to deep cover
Dernbach to Bailey, 1 bye full following Bailey who stepped to leg and misses, Buttler makes an excellent diving save and nearly gets up to run out Lynn
Dernbach to Lynn, no run slower ball on a length outside off, slapped off the toe of the bat back to the bowler
Dernbach to Lynn, no run full at leg stump, driven back to the bowler, well saved from Dernbach
Dernbach to Lynn, SIX runs length ball, Lynn steps to leg and swings it into the building site, nailed it. But the length was simply the wrong one
Dernbach to Lynn, (no ball) full toss at the body, Lynn gloves it down the leg side and it runs for four, definitely a no ball on height but byes given! I don't think so
Dernbach to Lynn, no run yorker at the stumps, forced back to the bowler
Dernbach to Lynn, 1 run steps across the line and swings to leg, not struck properly and a good job for Lynn because it lands in front of deep-square leg running in
Bresnan to Lynn, 2 runs full outside off, swung down the ground off a thick inside edge to long-off, they take on the fielder and get back for two, Bailey doesn't want the bowling
Bresnan to Lynn, no run yorker length just inside the guideline offside off - I love that delivery - tried to be chopped away but missed
Bresnan to Lynn, SIX runs just misses the length and gets whacked over long-off, lovely clean hit
Bresnan to Lynn, 1 run full and wide, reached for and gets a toe-end out to deep cover
Bresnan to Bailey, FOUR runs low full toss and Bailey finally times one, clubbing this wide of mid-on
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run full and wide, reached for again and gets a toe end to cover, 200 up
Dernbach to Bailey, OUT full delivery outside off out of the back of the hand, swung hard at and gets it straight up in the air and Bresnan takes the catch at point
Dernbach to Lynn, 2 runs full at the stumps, swung down the ground, they sprint and nick a second of long-on
Dernbach to Lynn, FOUR runs full at the stumps, Lynn steps to the off side and paddle sweeps, gets it over the 45 and that runs away for four, lovely touch
Dernbach to Lynn, 1 run right up there again, tries to play straight and forces it back to the bowler, they steal a single
Dernbach to Christian, FOUR runs steps right across the line and takes a length ball behind square on the leg side, somehow forces it between keeper and the 45
Dernbach to Christian, 2 runs swept hard and gets it between deep-midwicket and deep-square leg for a couple

That's a formidable total from Australia. White and Finch at the top were excellent and just as it looked as if England were dragging it back slightly, Lynn played a lovely little hand on debut to push Australia on. England have plenty of batting to do and they will begin their chase in 10 minutes...

Hello everyone, Alan here for the second dig. England's openers have a tough act to follow, though the total isn't quite as daunting as the 248 Australia racked up at the Ageas Bowl last year... England have never successfully chased 200 or more in T20, though they came close last year against New Zealand at The Oval. This target is actually more than they managed
Spin to start, from Glenn Maxwell
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run round the wicket, tossed up on leg stump and nudged through square for a single
Maxwell to Lumb, FOUR runs floated up and in the slot, Lumb drills this along the ground through cover for the first boundary
Maxwell to Lumb, no run fuller and a touch wide of the stumps, Lumb allows it through to the keeper
Maxwell to Lumb, 1 run gets on the front foot and dabs one into the covers
Maxwell to Hales, FOUR runs flat, pushed across the right-hander from round the wicket, Hales sits back and slashes behind point for four more
Maxwell to Hales, no run floated up on leg stump, Hales taps short to the on side
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, FOUR runs pitched up slightly wide and thrashed through point, in the air for a bit but in front of the diving fielder, four more
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, no run good pace, little bit of extra lift of a length, beats the bat as Lumb flirts outside off
Coulter-Nile to Wright, 1 leg bye swings across the line, down the leg side and it squirts off the pad
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs dug in short, Hales sees it big and swivel-pulls fiercely through backward square, wide open space and it races to the rope
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs fullish, in the corridor outside off and flashed through backward point this time, quicksilver hands from Hales
Hazlewood to Wright, no run good length and this jags back off the pitch, hits Wright on the knee roll but the appeal is declined
Hazlewood to Wright, 1 wide slings this down the leg side as Wright shuffles across - wide
Hazlewood to Wright, no run touch short, outside the line of off, tapped towards point
Hazlewood to Wright, FOUR runs back of a length, Wright doesn't really get near it but there's enough on a thickish top edge to send the ball over the leap of slip and away for another boundary
Hazlewood to Wright, no run bit of width, Wright stays back and steers a cut to backward point
Hazlewood to Wright, no run dug in short and at the batsman, he swats cross-batted at it, cloths the ball in the air short of mid-on
Hazlewood to Wright, 1 run length ball in the channel outside off, opens the face and slices one down to third man

Coulter-Nile to Wright, 1 leg bye hit on the pad, again seaming in but height an issue, Coulter-Nile is a tall man and gets considerable bounce... There's nearly a mix-up as the ball squirts into the off side but they get a leg bye
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run gets on the front foot and blocks a length ball to extra cover
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs not all that short but punched wristily through midwicket, little pirouette and a lot of bottom hand
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run pitched up outside off, driven in front of square
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs fullish, again in the channel, this time Hales larrups a lofted cover drive over the ring - four more, Hales is cruising
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 1 leg bye good line from Coulter-Nile, nibbles back but a thin inside edge saves the batsman from a plumb lbw shout
Henriques to Hales, 1 run length ball, takes a bit of bat and hits the pad before looping into the leg side - no one there though!
Henriques to Wright, FOUR runs slightly short and raked through square leg, muscular pull shot from Wright
Henriques to Root, no run fullish, pushed back to the bowler coming forward
Henriques to Root, 1 run goes across and works a single through square on the leg side
Hazlewood to Root, no run full of a length, outside off, poked back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Root, no run plays to leg, gets a leading edge
Hazlewood to Root, no run drops back and cuts into the ground towards point, again can't get it through
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run skips out and swings the arms, a billowing top edge sails down towards third man but short of the fielder
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run good line and length from Hazlewood, fired across the bows, Morgan watches it by
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run another dot ball, keeping Morgan honest in the channel outside off
Maxwell to Root, 1 run tossed up, outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off
Maxwell to Morgan, FOUR runs tossed up and smeared over cover, flowing swing of the bat from Morgan and the ball skids to the fence well in front of the off-side sweeper
Maxwell to Buttler, 1 run slides this down the leg side, tucked of the pads
Maxwell to Root, 1 run tossed up, around leg stump, pushed back past the bowler for one to long-on
Maxwell to Buttler, 2 runs tossed up on the stumps, Buttler works the ball through square, wide of the sweeper and they get two
Muirhead to Root, 1 run floated up outside off, driven on the up through the covers
Muirhead to Buttler, no run slightly short, Buttler stays back but can't beat cover with a punch
Muirhead to Buttler, SIX runs full and inviting and Buttler bites, tears off a huge chunk as a slog-sweep disappears into the stands at deep midwicket - England's first six
Muirhead to Buttler, 1 run slides this on towards leg stumps, worked through backward square
Muirhead to Root, 2 runs tossed up in the channel, nicely timed drive and it's into the gap between deep cover and long-off for a couple
Muirhead to Root, 1 run on the stumps, forces the ball through the covers to the sweeper
Maxwell to Root, 1 run pushed across from over the wicket, Root nurdles one into the off side
Maxwell to Buttler, FOUR runs back away and bunts four down the ground, powerful swing from Buttler's Popeye forearms and it only bounces once
Maxwell to Buttler, 1 run quicker and flatter, opens the face and runs one to short third man, Root gets home with a dive
Maxwell to Root, no run can't work this into a gap to leg
Maxwell to Root, FOUR runs full toss, Root latches on to it and clumps four out towards wide long-on
Maxwell to Root, 1 run tossed up, comes forward and pushes one more to long-off - decent over for England
Henriques to Root, SIX runs drops short, nailed over deep square leg for a flat six! Lovely timing on the hook from Root, who doesn't usually look capable of such power
Henriques to Root, FOUR runs another boundary, chipped over mid-off, leaned into the drive and picks up four
Henriques to Root, 1 run steers a short ball in front of point
Henriques to Buttler, 2 runs Buttler steps away and bullies a full ball flat and wide of long-off, they get back for two
Henriques to Buttler, no run good response from Henriques, slower ball outside off, Buttler fiddles and misses
Henriques to Buttler, 1 run pitched up, chopped back down the ground for one more to long-off
Christian to Buttler, no run off the pad into the leg side, Buttler starts to run, no where near a single on and Wade almost runs him out
Christian to Buttler, 1 run step to leg, follow him, clubbed off a thick inside edge to long-on
Christian to Root, no run length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket
Christian to Root, 1 run slower ball again, swung to leg and it lands well short of deep-midwicket
Christian to Buttler, 1 run full at the stumps, driven firmly at the bowler who fumbles and they get a single to long-off
Christian to Root, FOUR runs low full toss, swung over midwicket, only just over midwicket reaching up and it runs away for four
Coulter-Nile to Root, no run length outside off, gets it off the toe back to the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Root, 2 runs full outside off and Root carves it to deep cover, the return throw cannons the stumps and they get a buzzard
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run full on the off stump and Bopara plays the perfect straight drive, unfortunately long-off is back so it's just a single
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, no run length outside off, chopped on the bounce to point
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run short and pulled out to deep-square leg
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 run dragged down and cut out to deep cover
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run floated up onto leg stump, dropped into midwicket and they race for two but can't get back
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 run full length and tucked out to long-on
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run touch short and blasted out to deep cover
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 wide down leg side, swept and missed
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 run floated up on the stumps and clipped out to long-on
Hazlewood to Bresnan, 1 run back of a length and slapped out to long-on
Hazlewood to Bopara, SIX runs length ball on off stump and whacked into the bank over midwicket
Hazlewood to Bopara, no run full length on off stump, driven to extra-cover
Hazlewood to Bopara, SIX runs full on off stump and Bopara clears the midwicket fence again, bigger strike this one
Hazlewood to Bopara, 1 run full again but further outside off, Bopara plays a lavish off drive on the bounce to long-off
Hazlewood to Bresnan, 1 run good yorker, dug out into the covers
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 run floated up on the stumps, driven down to long-off
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run flat delivery outside off, forced off the back foot where point saves well diving to his right
Muirhead to Bresnan, no run leg stump line, slapped off a thick inside edge back to the bowler
Muirhead to Bresnan, no run big swing and a miss to a ball spinning away from off stump, appeal for a stumping and we'll have a check on this but Bresnan is back in time
Muirhead to Bresnan, 1 run forced off the back foot out to deep cover
Muirhead to Bopara, 2 runs floated up on leg stump and worked through square leg, hard running brings two
Henriques to Bresnan, 1 run full just outside off, mistimed drive to long-off
Henriques to Bopara, SIX runs low full toss and Bopara flicks it over long-on, marvellous timing
Henriques to Bopara, SIX runs full outside off and Bopara swings it over long-on again, full flourish of the bat and it's into the terraces again
Henriques to Bopara, 1 run better length outside off and Bopara can only slap it down to long-off
Henriques to Bresnan, 1 run good yorker again and it's just a single to long-off
Henriques to Bopara, 1 run full outside off again, carved out to deep cover
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run full toss and Bopara can only mistime it to deep midwicket, that should have gone to Sydney
Muirhead to Bresnan, 2 runs another full toss, this is bunted down the ground and they get two running hard taking on long-on
Muirhead to Broad, SIX runs swept first ball over square leg, lovely strike over the short boundary
Muirhead to Broad, 1 run back and goes to pull, gets a toe end to long-on
Muirhead to Bopara, 1 run low full toss on off stump, clipped down to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run yorker just outside off, dug out down to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Broad, no run decent bumper, Broad tries to stay inside it and uppercut but misses
Coulter-Nile to Broad, SIX runs another short ball, this time Broad steps inside it and pulls hard over square leg into the building site
Coulter-Nile to Dernbach, no run length ball outside off, Dernbach aims a huge swing at it and misses
Coulter-Nile to Dernbach, no run full on off stump, carved out to deep cover but they refuse the run to keep Bopara on strike
Christian to Bopara, 1 run back of a length, heaved into the leg side, comes off high on the bat and rolls to deep-square leg for just a single
Christian to Dernbach, FOUR runs full on leg stump and Dernbach slogs it down the ground, straight as a dye and gets four, good stroke actually
Christian to Dernbach, 1 run back of a length, carved out towards deep-cover, Lynn flies forward at it and almost pulls off a blinding catch
Christian to Bopara, FOUR runs punchy drive through extra cover, lovely stroke, excellent timing
Christian to Bopara, FOUR runs back of a length and swung into the leg side gap in front of square, four more
Hazlewood to Bopara, 5 wide five wides to start, England still in the game!!
Hazlewood to Bopara, no run not anymore, standing outside off, aimed a swing at a ball outside off but only finds the bowler having mistimed it
Hazlewood to Bopara, SIX runs low full toss and Bopara plays a delightful lofted drive over long-off and Bopara now has the fastest T20 fifty for England
Hazlewood to Bopara, no run another low full toss, swung to leg but this isn't quite timed and they refuse any runs towards cow corner
Hazlewood to Bopara, SIX runs full on the stumps and swung backward of square and over the rope, another superb strike
Hazlewood to Bopara, SIX runs length outside off, Bopara slogs it with one hand and manages to clear the boundary again! What an innings this is!
Hazlewood to Bopara, 1 run around the wicket, forced from off stump to deep-midwicket

Lovely innings from Bopara, a new career top score for him in international T20s, but he was left with far too much work to do after the top order failed and England have lost again, Australia taking this opening T20 by 13 runs. That England made 200 in reply shows what could have been achieved but their batting wasn't up to scratch at all. By contrast Australia h

Here's the Presentation. Man of the Match is Cameron White for his innings at the top of the order. We haven't heard from George Bailey so I can't bring you the thoughts of the winning skipper I'm afraid.
That's all from Hobart, two more games to come in this series, Melbourne on Friday and Sydney on Sunday, same time, same channel you be sure of it, bye for now...
Australia won by 13 runs
Player of the match is Cameron White, AUS
